Entalpic

AI-driven materials research for a fair and ecological transition.

Entalpic is in for the long run.

Our mission is to discover new materials and chemical processes that lead to more sustainable practices in sectors where the need for change is most urgent.

Specifically, we develop a modern generative AI platform to discover new catalysts that optimize chemical reactions, factoring in physicochemical and manufacturing constraints.

We are just starting and welcome collaborations and partnerships. If you are interested in working with us, please get in touch !

Founders

Mathieu Galtier , CEO. With a PhD in applied math, Mathieu has spent the last decade building teams in startups and biotechs embodying the "Machine Learning for science" deeptech approach.

Victor Schmidt , CTO. With a PhD in Machine Learning supervised by Yoshua Bengio, Victor is devoting his engineering skills to contribute to climate change mitigation.

Alexandre Duval , CS(cience)O. With a PhD in Machine Learning for chemistry, Alex is passionate about Graph Neural Networks and their applications to materials science.

We are hiring!

We are looking for talented individuals to join our core team. If you are passionate about AI, chemistry, sustainability, and innovation, we want to hear from you!

Current positions available: ML Engineer, Data Scientist, Material Scientist, Computational Chemist, ML Ops, and more.

Apply now!

Research

Here is a list of papers related to Entalpic's research interests.

Some of them we are authors on, some others are just cool papers we like. Enjoy!

A Hitchhiker's Guide to Geometric GNNs for 3D Atomic Systems

This paper provides a comprehensive overview of Geometric Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) for modeling 3D atomic systems, highlighting their architectures, applications, and future directions.

MatterGen: a generative model for inorganic materials design

This paper introduces a diffusion-based generative model designed to create new inorganic materials by learning and leveraging patterns from existing material datasets.

An Introduction to Electrocatalyst Design using Machine Learning for Renewable Energy Storage

This paper explores how machine learning techniques can be applied to design electrocatalysts, aiming to improve renewable energy storage solutions.

FAENet: Frame Averaging Equivariant GNN for Materials Modeling

This paper presents a fast, simple and expressive Geometric Graph Neural Network that enforces euclidean symmetries via a data projection step instead of model-design equivariant constraints.

A foundation model for atomistic materials chemistry

This paper introduces a single general-purpose ML model for atomistic materials chemistry, capable of running stable molecular dynamics on a diverse set of problems in the physical sciences.

Challenges in high-throughput inorganic material prediction and autonomous synthesis

This paper discusses problems that can arise in unsupervised materials discovery, and hope that by addressing these, autonomous materials discovery can be brought closer to reality.
